checkpoint.name: Presumptive surveillance register is available at PHC
Presumptive surveillance register contain information as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Recording of date &personal details (Name, age& Sex) of case as well as write probable diagnosis of disease based on clinical examination or record of presenting symptoms

checkpoint.name: Health worker is competant to conduct test for drinking water sources at village level
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Test Ortho Toludine test (using chloroscope). Accepted value on consumer side is 0.2 -0.8 ppm

checkpoint.name: MO/ treating Physician is using Presumptive surveillance register for recording of cases during routine OPD activities.
There is some designated person to supervise the job and confirm information before submitting
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: MO confirm the information before submission

checkpoint.name: Hospital has system in place to count and fill weekly total of cases before starting the new week
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check total is available on Top left hand corner of the every page of register

checkpoint.name: Laboratory technician of PHC is aware of IDSP target diseases required to be reported on weekly basis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Laboratory assistant/technician at PHC are required to report for Malaria, Tuberculosis & Typhoid

checkpoint.name: PHC has defined schedule for testing of drinking water sources
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Frequency of testing is decided by MO on basis of incidence of water borne diseases. During out break test must be done at least once in a day

checkpoint.name: Elementary diagnosis of Mental disorders as per guidelines
Treatment of functional psychosis as per guidelines
Treatment of uncomplicated cases of psychiatric cases associated with physical diseases as per guidelines
Management of uncomplicated psychosocial problems as per guidelines
Epidemiological surveillance of mental disorders as per guideline
Treatment of falciparum failure cases is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Falciparum malaria should be given alternative ACT or quinine with Doxycycline. Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy, lactation and in children up to 8 years.

checkpoint.name: Treatment of uncomplicated P. falciparum Malaria in pregnancy is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Pregnant women with uncomplicated Falciparum should be treated 1st trimester: Quinine, 2nd &3rd trimester: ACT

checkpoint.name: Different coloured blister packs of ACT+SP is available for different age group especially for field staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: e.g: Pink for 0-1 year, yellow for 1-5 yrs, green for 5-8 yrs, Red for 9-14 yrs & white for 1 5& above. For NE: pack colour and regimen vary by body weight & age group, Yellow: weight for 5to 14 kg and age for> 5 month to <3 years, green: weight 15 to 24 kg age >3 to 8yrs, Red : weight 25-34 kg, age 9 to 14 yrs, white:weight > 34 kg,and age >14 yrs

checkpoint.name: Patient on malaria treatment (specially on Primaquine) are provided with information about when to report back
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Patients should be instructed to report back in case of haematuria or high colored urine / cyanosis or blue coloration of lips and Primaquine should be stopped

checkpoint.name: Staff is trained to identify severe cases of malaria especially severe manifestation of P falciparum
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Severe malaria have one or more of following features: impaired consciousness/coma,Repeated generalized convulsions, Renal failure (Serum Creatinine >3 mg/dl), Jaundice (Serum Bilirubin >3 mg/dl), Severe anaemia (Hb <5 g/dl), Pulmonary oedema, Hypoglycaemia (Plasma Glucose <40 mg/dl), Circulatory collapse/shock, DIC, Hyperpyrexia,Hyperparasitaemia (>5% parasitized RBCs ), Haemoglobinuria etc.

checkpoint.name: Treatment for Confirmed P. falciparum is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: P. falciparum cases are treated with ACT (Artesunate 3days+Sulphadoxine- Pyrimethamine 1 day) This is accompanied by single dose of Pramaquine preferably day 2). However, there is resistance to partner drug SP in NE, it is recommended to use ARTEMETHER( 20 mg) - LUMEFANTRINE (120 mg (ACT-AL) as per age specific dose schedule for the treatment of pf cases in NE (contraindicated in 1st trimester of pregnancy & for children weighting <5 years)

checkpoint.name: Health worker/Health professionals are skilled to identify cases of suspected malaria
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Fever is cardinal symptom. It may be intermittent with or without priodicity or continuous, Fever in many cases accompanied with rigours & chills. Headache, myalgia, arthralgia, anorexia, nausea & vomiting.

checkpoint.name: Identification of drug resistance /failure cases especially falciparum is done as per protocols
Algorithm for treatment & diagnosis of malaria is available with treating physician
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of Alogrithm

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of cases contraindicated for administration of Primaquine
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Primaquine is used to prevent relapse but is contraindicated in pregnant 
women, infants and individuals with G6PD deficiency.

checkpoint.name: Treatment for confirmed P. Vivax Malaria is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
P.vivax cases should be treated with chloroquine for three days and Primaquine for 
14 days.

checkpoint.name: Treatment of mixed infection is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Mixed infections with P. falciparum should be treated as falciparum malaria. However, antirelapse treatment with primaquine can be given for 14 days, if indicated.

checkpoint.name: Microscopic result is available within defined period
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Within 24 hrs. If in Pf predominant area result is not available with in 24 hrs. check the provision of RDT

checkpoint.name: Follow up of smear examination for New smear positive patient is done as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: First follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 2 months of intensive phase. Follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 2 month of continution phase and finally at the end of treatment.

checkpoint.name: Follow up smear examination for re -treatment patients as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: First follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 3 months of intensive phase. Follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 2 month of continution phase and finally at the end of treatment.

checkpoint.name: Determination of treatment outcome for each patient as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Cured, treatment completed, Died, defaulted, & transferred out.

checkpoint.name: Treatment of the patient during pregnancy and post natal period is done as per guidelines
DOT directory is maintained &updated at healthcare facility level
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: For identify suitable DOT provider & DOT centre

checkpoint.name: Management of paediatric tuberculosis as per guidelines
Duplicate treatment card is issued to DOT provider/community DOT provider if DOT provider is situtated outside the healthcare centre
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: original card is maintained at healthcare centre where treatment has started

checkpoint.name: All the doses of intensive phase is taken as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Under supervision of DOT provider/Community DOT provider if any dose is missed patient must be contacted within 1 day and dose is administrated on following day

checkpoint.name: Medical officer also discuss about near by DOT centre with the patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Easily accessible and acceptable by patient, Place identified for DOT (DOT centre) & name and designation of DOT provider is written in patient treatment card

checkpoint.name: Category wise treatment regimen is given to patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Category I- New sputum smear-positive
Seriously ill** new sputum smear-negative
Seriously ill** new extra-pulmonary- 2H3R3Z3E3+
4H3R3, Category II- Sputum smear-positive Relapse
Sputum smear-positive Failure
Sputum smear-positive Treatment After Default
Others***- 2H3R3Z3E3S3 +
1H3R3Z3E3 +
5H3R3E3,

checkpoint.name: Original treatment card is updated at regular intervals by PHW
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Fortnightly Basis

checkpoint.name: In continuous phase doses is taken as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: First dose in taken under supervision of DOT provider/Community DOT provider and for subsequent doses for week is self administrated. Empty blisters are contacted within next scheduled visit

checkpoint.name: Management of Extra pulmonary tuberculosis as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Diagnostic algorithm for TB lymphadenitis

checkpoint.name: Treatment of patient taking oral contraceptive pills is done as per guidelines
Prior to start of treatment patient identity card & and treatment card is prepared
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Address of the patient is verified by Peripheral Health worker before start of the treatment Within 1 week of diagnosis

checkpoint.name: Patient wise box are colour coded as per category
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Red - Category I, Blue -Category -II,

checkpoint.name: Follow up smear examination for smear negative patients as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Two smears are examined during the follow-up visit at the end of 2 months of the intensive phase and again at the end of treatment

checkpoint.name: Management of patient with HIV infection and TB
Side effects of anti TB treatment is identified by DOT provider and reported to MO
Medical officer issue Patient wise box (PWB) for entire duration for treatment to Peripheral Health worker/DOT provider
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the stock to be maintained

checkpoint.name: What action is taken if patient misses DOT on 2 occasion in Intensive phase
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Arrange visit of MO- PHI to patient home for counselling of the patient.

checkpoint.name: What action taken by DOT provider if they fail to retrieve such patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Reported to next level supervisor (PHW/MO- PHI/STS/ MO-TB)

checkpoint.name: Process to estimate baseline CD4 count of HIV positive pregnant women
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Whole blood samples of all pregnant women who are diagnosed to be HIV-positive in an ICTC will be sent to the nearest ART centre with CD4 testing facility for estimation of the baseline CD4 count.

checkpoint.name: Criteria to diagnosis the cases of HIV in window period
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Such cases require testing after 12 weeks

checkpoint.name: Method to transport the blood sample to ART centre
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Whole blood sample of the HIV-positive pregnant woman will be drawn on a fixed day in the week in consultation with the nearest ART centre and collected in EDTA vacuum tube and sent to the nearest ART centre in a cold box through a messenger. It has to be ensured that the sample reaches the nearest ART centre within 24 hours of drawing of the sample.

checkpoint.name: Criteria followed for HIV testing of blood samples received at ICTC
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Blood sample may be sent from the hospital ward or other department, in such cases the ICTC ensure that the patient has been counselled by the doctor and the blood sample is received with a requisition slip. Post-test counselling will be provided by the ICTC counsellor in the ward.

checkpoint.name: Criteria to diagnosis HIV in new born
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: For diagnosis HIV in new born test should be done when infant is of 6 weeks old and second one at six month of age

checkpoint.name: Criteria to diagnosis the case of HIV in emergency case
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: For women with an unknown HIV status and in labour, the labour room nurses or medical officer will provide basic information on HIV/AIDS and about HIV testing. Thereafter, a single HIV test will be performed. A repeat sample will be collected and tested on the next working day and sent the ICTC.

checkpoint.name: Check the method to declare client HIV Positive
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A client is declared to be HIV-positive when the same blood sample is tested three times using kits with different antigens/principles and the result of all three tests is positive.

checkpoint.name: Anaemia Management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Weekly IFA tablet given to adolescent girls, distribution through class teachers

checkpoint.name: Medical Examination of the student is done as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Medical examination include general health checkup,Physical measurement & personal hygiene, Eye examination, Ear discharge& hearing problem,Common dental defects,congenital heart defects,disability screening, learning disoders, behaviour disoders,stress and anxiety etc

checkpoint.name: Eye care services are provided as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Screening by teacher, PMOA assesssment & conformation, order of spectacles & supply of spectacles

checkpoint.name: Dental care services are provided as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: screening by teacher, sent to dental camp at block level, filling, extraction and referral during camp

checkpoint.name: School medical team is formed at PHC level
School environment survey is done by PHC staff as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Survey includes safe water & clean sanitation, hygienic class room & environment, Quality of food provided

checkpoint.name: De worming as per guidleines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Biannually administration of Albendazole

checkpoint.name: Action plan for school health is available at PHC level
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: There is fixed as school health day, Each school should be visited 3 times/ year

checkpoint.name: Availability of protocols for visual acuity measurement for aged/ adult aged 45yrs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check flow chart/ Instruction available with POA

checkpoint.name: Availability of protocols for visual acuity measurement for children
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check flow chart/ Instruction available with POA

checkpoint.name: A simple questionnaire will be filled up during the first visit of each Elderly as per guideline and record updated and maintained

Health assessment for elderly person based on simple clinical examination relating to vision, joints, hearing, chest, BP and simple
investigations including blood sugar, etc. is done
PHC has designated and secure place to keep Records including Patient Records
Hospital has policy for retention period for different kinds of records
A person is designated for safe keeping and retrieval of records
Hospital has policy for safe disposal of records
Delivery note is adequate
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Outcome of delivery, date and time, gestation age, delivery conducted by, type of delivery, complication if any ,indication of intervention, date and time of transfer, cause of death etc

checkpoint.name: Baby note is adequate
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Did baby cry, Essential new born care, resuscitation if any, Sex, weight, time of initiation of breast feed, birth doses, congenital anomaly if any.

checkpoint.name: Any dressing/injection, other procedure recorded in the OPD slip
Any procedure performed written on BHT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Dressing, mobilization etc.

checkpoint.name: Progress of labour is recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Partograph Full compliance and on bed head ticket partial compliance

checkpoint.name: Day to day progress of patient is recorded in BHT
Patient History, Complaints and Examination Diagnosis/ Provisional Diagnosis is recorded in OPD slip
Treatment plan, first orders are written on BHT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Treatment prescribed inj nursing records

checkpoint.name: Treatment prescribed in nursing records
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Medication order, treatment plan, lab investigation are recoded adequately

checkpoint.name: Written Prescription Treatment plan is documented
Standard Format for bed head ticket/ Patient case sheet available as per state guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Availability of formats for Treatment Charts, TPR Chart , Intake Output Chat Etc.

checkpoint.name: Standard Formats available
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Printed formats for requisition and reporting are available

checkpoint.name: Availability of Form / Format for testing and Diagnosis of TB under RNTCP
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Mycobacteriology culture/sensitivity test form
Laboratory form for sputum examination
tuberculosis treatment Card 
referral treatment form
transfer form

checkpoint.name: Standard Formats available
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Availability of BHT, Partograph, etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of formats for National Leprosy Eradication Program
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Assessment of disability &Nerve function/Disability assessment form (P1/S1/T1), Sensory assessment, Predisolone Card (P4/S4/T4), Referral Slip for ASHA/HW/PHC/CHC (P5/S5)

checkpoint.name: Check for the availability of OPD slip, Requisition slips etc.
Records are maintained at laboratory
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Test registers, IQAS/EQAS Registers, Expenditure registers, Accession list etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of records for National Leprosy Eradication Program
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Disability register (P1/S1), Record of lepra reactions/Neuritis cases (form P3/S3/T3)

checkpoint.name: Registers and records are maintained as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: labour room register, OT register, MTP register,FP register, Maternal death register and records, lab register, referral in /out register, internal& PPIUD register etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Records for School Health Program
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Health appraisal register (Appraisal register contain information on date of visit1, visit2 &visit 3, class,name & type of school, name of student,age, height, weight, clincal diagnosis, treatment, referred to, follow up and immunization status), Referral register
Drug stock register

checkpoint.name: Registers and records are maintained as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: General order book (GOB), report book, Admission register, lab register, Admission sheet/ bed head ticket, discharge slip, referral slip, referral in/referral out register, OT register, FP register, Diet register, Linen register, Drug intend register

checkpoint.name: Availability of Records for RNTCP
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
TB laboratory monthly abstract 
Referral/Treatment Register
TB Register

checkpoint.name: OPD records are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: OPD register, Drug Expenditure Register Injection room register etc.

checkpoint.name: Blind register is maintained at facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Blind register have information on name of district, block /PHC, village, name of patient along with address and age, visual acuity (Left & right), Main cause of blindness, & outcome)

checkpoint.name: There is fixed schedule for assessment of stable patients
Initial assessment of all admitted patient are done as per standard protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The assessment criteria for different clinical conditions are defined and measured in assessment sheet

checkpoint.name: Rapid Initial assessment of Pregnant Women to identify complication and Prioritize care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Assessment and immediate sign if following danger sign are present - difficulty in breathing, fever, sever abdominal pain, Convulsion or unconsciousness, Severe headache or blurred vision

checkpoint.name: Initial assessment and treatment is provided immediately
There is fixed schedule for reassessment of Pregnant women as per standard protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: There is fix schedule of reassessment as per protocols

checkpoint.name: Partograph is used and updated as per stages of labour
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: All step are recorded in timely manner

checkpoint.name: Dangers signs are identified and recorded for post delivery cases
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Examines the perineum for inflammation, status of episiotomy/tears, lochia for colour, amount, consistency and odour, Checks calf tenderness, redness or swelling

checkpoint.name: Recording and reporting of Clinical History
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Recording of women obstetric History including
LMP and EDD Parity, gravid status, h/o CS, Live birth, Still Birth, Medical History (TB, Heart diseases, STD etc, HIV status and Surgical History

checkpoint.name: Initial Assessment and reassessment of patient addmitted for illness other than pregnency is done & recorded
Provisional Diagnosis is recorded
ANC history of pregnant women is reviewed and recorded
Recording of current labour details
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Time of start, frequency of contractions, time of bag of water leaking, colour and smell of fluid and baby movement

checkpoint.name: Initial assessment is documented preferably within 2 hours
Dangers signs are identified and recorded for other cases like Breathlessness, Altered sensorium, Diplopia, Acute Abdomen, Chest Pain, etc
Physical Examination is done and recorded wherever required
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Assesses general condition, including: vital signs, conjunctiva for pallor and jaundice, and bladder and bowel function, conducts breast examinations

checkpoint.name: Physical Examination is done and recorded wherever required
Physical Examination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Recording of Vitals , shape & Size of abdomen , presence of scars, foetal lie and presentation. & vaginal examination

checkpoint.name: Patient History is taken and recorded
There is a system of follow up of referred patients
There is a system of follow up of referred patients
Facility has functional referral linkages to lower facilities
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for referral cards filled from lower facilities

checkpoint.name: Laboratory has referral linkage for tests not available at the facility
Referral vehicle is being arranged
Facility maintains list of higher centres where patient can be managed.
Patient referred with referral slip
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A referral slip/ Discharge card is provide to patient when referred to another health care facility

checkpoint.name: Facility ensures the referral patient to public healthcare facilities
There is a system of referring patient from OPD to higher centre for specialist consultation
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for practice, availability of referral slip, is there any information about the specialist doctors and there timings and day available

checkpoint.name: Referral in or referral out register is maintained
Advance communication is done with higher centre
Referral vehicle is being arranged
Patient referred with referral slip
Referral in or referral out register is maintained
Advance communication is done with higher centre
There is system of follow up of the patients discharged form higher facilities
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check system of follow up visit of ANM, ASHA or visit to PHC.

checkpoint.name: Referral Linkages to ICTC and PPTCT
Privacy and confidentiality maintained at ARSH clinic
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Screens and curtains for visual privacy,confidentaility policy displayed, one client at a time

checkpoint.name: Counselling and provision of reversible Contraceptives
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the availability of Oral Contraceptive Pills, Condoms and IUD

checkpoint.name: Counselling and provision of emergency contraceptive pills
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the availability of Emergency Contraceptive pills (Levonorgesterol)

checkpoint.name: Information and advice on sexual and reproductive health related issues
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Advice on topic related to Growth and development, puberty, sexuality concern, myths & misconception, pregnancy, safe sex, contraception, unsafe abortion, menstrual disorders, anemia, sexual abuse, RTI/STI's etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability and Display of IEC material
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Poster Displayed, Reading Material hand-outs etc.

checkpoint.name: Services for Prophylaxis against Nutritional Anaemia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Haemoglobin estimation, weekly IFA tablet, and treatment for worm infestation

checkpoint.name: Provision of Antenatal natal check up for pregnant adolescent
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Nutritional Counselling, Contraceptive counselling, 
Couple counselling ANC check-up, 
Ensuring institutional delivery

checkpoint.name: Services for Tetanus immunization
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: TT at 10 and 16 year

checkpoint.name: Services for early and safe termination of pregnancy and management of post abortion complication
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: MVA procedure for pregnancy up to 8 week Post abortion counselling

checkpoint.name: Nutrition Counselling
Treatment and counselling for sexual concern for male and female adolescents
Treatment of Common RTI/STI's
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Privacy and Confidentiality, Treatment compliance, Partner Management, Follow up visit and referral

checkpoint.name: Treatment and counselling for Menstrual disorders
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Symptomatic treatment , counselling

checkpoint.name: Management of sexual abuse amongst Girls
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: ECP, Prophylaxis against STI, PEP for HIV and Counselling

checkpoint.name: Use of Uterotonic Drugs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Administration of 10 IU of oxytocin IM with in 1 minute of Birth

checkpoint.name: Uterine Massage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: After placenta expulsion , Checks Placenta & Membranes for Completeness

checkpoint.name: Control Cord Traction
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Only during Contraction

checkpoint.name: Management of 1st stage of labour:
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check progress is recorded, Women is allowed to give birth in the position she wants , Check progress is recorded on partograph

checkpoint.name: Management of 2nd stage of labour:
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Allows the spontaneous delivery of head , gives Perineal support and assist in delivering baby. Check progress is recorded on partograph

checkpoint.name: Active Management of Third stage of labour
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Palpation of mother's abdomen to rule out presence of second baby

checkpoint.name: APGAR Score
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check practice of maintaining APGAR Score, Nurse is skilled for it

checkpoint.name: Administration of Vitamin K for low birth weight New born
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Given to all new born (1.0 mg IM in > 1500 gms and 0.5 mg in < 1500 gms

checkpoint.name: New born is Dried and put on mothers abdomen
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: With a clean towel from head to feet, discards the used towel and covers baby including head in a clean dry towel

checkpoint.name: Warmth to the New born
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check use of radiant warmer

checkpoint.name: Kangaroo Mother Care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe /Ask staff about the practice

checkpoint.name: Recording of date, Time of Birth & Weight of new born
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records

checkpoint.name: New born Resuscitation
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask Nursing staff to demonstrate Resuscitation Technique

checkpoint.name: Care of Cord and Eyes of New born
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Delayed Cord Clamping, Clamps & Cut the cords by sterile instruments within 1-3 minutes of Birth 
Clean baby's eyes with sterile cotton/Gauge

checkpoint.name: Zero Day immunization (OPV, BCG, Hep B; as per GoI schedule).
Initial Management of Eclampsia \Pre Eclampsia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
As staff about how they manage eclampsia cases (Monitors BP in every case, and tests for proteinuria if BP is >140/90 mmHg with convulsion and proteinuria following management is done by - 
Position woman on her left side
Ensure clear airway (u se padded mouth gag 
after convu lsion is over) 
Do gentle oral suction
Give Inj. Magnesium Sulphate
5g (10ml, 50% ) in each buttock deep I.M.)
If delivery is not imminent refer the patient to FRU

checkpoint.name: Management of Retained Placenta
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Administration of another dose of Oxytocin 20IU in 500 ml of RL at 40-60 drops/min and refer the patient to FRU

checkpoint.name: Management of Atonic PPH
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Bimanual compression of uterus, continue inj oxytocin 20 IU in 500 ml RL/DNS
Administer another uterotonic drug (Inj Methergine/ Tab Misoprostol) 
If Patient still bleeds refer to FRU

checkpoint.name: Management of Obstructed Labour
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Diagnoses obstructed labour based on data registered from the partograph, Re-hydrates the patient to maintain normal plasma volume, check vitals, gives broad spectrum antibiotics, perform bladder catheterization and takes blood for Hb & grouping, Decides on the mode of delivery as per the condition of mother and the baby

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of Indications for refereeing patient for to higher center
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff how they identify slow progress of labour , How they interpret Partogram

checkpoint.name: Post Partum Haemorrhage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask staff how they manage pots partum haemorrhage 
Assessment of bleeding (PPH if >500 ml or > 1 pad soaked in 5 Minutes. IV Fluid, bladder catheterization, measurement of urine output, Administration of 20 IU of Oxytocin in 500 ml Normal Saline or RL at 40-60 drops per minute . Performs Bimanual Compression of Uterus
If placenta is not delivered continue Inj Inj Oxytocin 20 IU in 500 ml RL @ 40-60 drops per minute and refer to FRU

checkpoint.name:
The client is given full information about optimal pregnancy spacing and
its benefits, as a part of FP health education and counselling.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
The importance of timely initiation of an FP method after childbirth, miscarriage,
or abortion will be emphasized.

checkpoint.name: The client is informed additional benefits of using condoms, such as prevention of sexually transmitted infections (STIs) & HIV
Staff is aware of case selecting criteria for family planning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
49-22 years of age
Married
Youngest child is at least one year old
Spouse has not opted for sterilization

checkpoint.name: Client is counselled about the options for family planning available
IUD insertion is done as per standard protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No touch technique, Speculum and bimanual examination, sounding of uterus and placement

checkpoint.name: Follow up services are provided as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Beneficiary are advised about indications for removal of IUD
Facility for removal of IUD are available

checkpoint.name: Client is informed about the adverse effect that can happen and their remedy
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Cramping, vaginal discharge, heavier menstruation, checking of IUD

checkpoint.name: The client is given full information about the risks, advantages, and possible side effects before OCPs are prescribed for her.
Pills are given only to those who meet the Medical Eligibility Criteria
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Contraindication of COC in Breastfeeding mothers within 6week and Hypertension

checkpoint.name: Staff has knowledge to counsel if a dose of the contraceptive is missed
Staff is aware of indication and method of administration of ECP
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: within 72 hours, second dose 12 house after first dose

checkpoint.name: Pre procedure Counselling is provided
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: As per national Guidelines

checkpoint.name: Counselling on the follow-up visit
Post procedure Counselling provided
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: As per national guidelines

checkpoint.name: Medical termination of pregnancy done as per guidelines
MVA procedures are done as per guidelines
There is procedure for systematic calling of patients one by one
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Patient is called by Doctor/attendant as per his/her turn on the basis of first come first examine basis.

checkpoint.name: Every patient is offered a seat and is examined as per clinical condition
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No patient is consulted in standing position

checkpoint.name: Clinical staff is not engaged in administrative work at OPD
Unique laboratory identification number is given to each patient sample
Patient demographic details are recorded in OPD registration records
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for that patient demographics like Name, age, Sex, Address etc.

checkpoint.name: Unique identification number is given to each patient during process of registration
Patient demographic details are recorded in the admission record
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for that patient demographics like Name, age, Sex, Chief complaint, etc.

checkpoint.name: Unique identification number is given to each patient during process of registration
Facility ensures that there is process for admission of patients after routine working hours
There is no delay in treatment because of admission process
Time of admission is recorded in patient record
Laboratory has system in place to monitor the transportation of the sample
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Transportation of sample includes: Time frame, temperature and carrier specified for transportation

checkpoint.name: Laboratory has system in place to label the primary sample
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check how slides/test tubes/vials are marked (Permanent Glass Marker is available)

checkpoint.name: Requisition of all laboratory test is done in request form
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Request form contain information: Name and identification number of patient, name of authorized requester, type of primary sample, examination requested, date and time of primary sample collection and date and time of receipt of sample by laboratory,

checkpoint.name: Instructions for collection and handling of primary sample are communicated to those responsible for collection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Instructions are given to ASHA/ANM/MPW for collection of samples (Peripheral smear, sputum, water sample

checkpoint.name: Laboratory has system to trace the primary sample from requisition form
Availability of Standard operating procedure for equipments required for malarial diagnosis
Availability of Standard operating procedure for processes required for malarial diagnosis
Laboratory has system to retain the copies of reported result and promptly retrieved when required
